sen.j: かえしとは「煮かえし」の略された物で、蕎麦汁（そばつゆ）に使われる調味料。
sen.e: The term Kaeshi is abbreviation of 'Nikaeshi', a seasoning used for soba (buckwheat noodles) dipping sauce.

sen.j: 醤油に砂糖、みりん（場合によっては日本酒など）を加え、しばらく寝かせる事によって作られる。
sen.e: It is made by adding sugar and mirin (sweet cooking rice wine) (sake, Japanese liquor, is possible) to soy sauce, and letting stand for a while.

sen.e: What is made by adding mirin again to Kaeshi and letting stand, is called Gozen-gaeshi or Uwa-gaeshi, which is used for zaru-soba (soba topped with sliced nori seaweed served on a latticed bamboo tray) sauce.
